repository.corpname: Marist College Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: The Catholic Studies Collection consists of both local materials pertaining to the state of New York and Dutchess County, as well as general materials on Catholicism throughout the United States and abroad. The collection contains parish histories, the papers and preparation notes of Louis Zuccarello, videos, photographs of local churches, audio tapes, materials on education, essays, and various newspapers and newspaper clippings on issues pertaining to Catholicism.
did.physloc: Please contact the Marist College Archives and Special Collections for information regarding use and access of this collection.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Catholic Studies Collection contains various documents, photographs, books, essays, pamphlets, newspapers, and audio and video tapes all having to do with Catholicism and/ or topics which touched on Catholicism and the lives of Catholics in the years from 1870 through 2003.

acqinfo.head: Acquisitions Informantion
acqinfo.p: The Catholic Studies Collection was given to the Marist Library by Louis Zuccarello.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Catholicism has played an important role in Dutchess County as Louis Zuccarello set out to show by compiling this collection. With parishes springing up all over Dutchess County to serve the needs of the various ethnic groups, Catholicism was a vital element of the community and in America in general. American bishops in New York and the Dutchess area, like Nilan and Burtsell were getting involved in trying to reform the religion and align it more closely with people’s lifestyles and values in America, as the Americanism school of thought sprung up and climaxed in the late 1800s. Catholicism also played an important role in the education of the local populace as different parishes opened up their own schools, colleges, and seminaries.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions to Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection

userestrict.head: Notice of Copyright
userestrict.p: Individuals requesting reproductions expressly assume the responsibility for compliance with all pertinent provisions of the Copyright Act, 17 U.S.C. ss101 et seq. For more information please visit the following website: http://www.loc.gov/copyright/title17/.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Description of item, date, location of item in order of series, box number, folder number ], in the Catholic Studies Collection, James A. Cannavino Library, Marist College.

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged into two series: 1) Catholic Studies, general, with seven subseries, and 2) The Catholic Church in New York, with seven subseries.

scopecontent.p: Series contains subseries Newspapers, Books/ Journals on Law, History, and Catholicism, Audio Visual Materials, Education, College, Sodality, Assorted, General
Series contains a collection of assorted Catholic New York Newspapers spanning from 1983 – 2000. There is also an issue of Stars and Stripes covering Desert Storm and Queen of Peace from 1995.

did.unittitle: Subseries 1.2: Books/ Journals on Law, History, and Catholicism

scopecontent.p: Series contains various books and journals dealing with different Catholic issues and history.

did.unittitle: Past and Present. A Journal of History and Government. Vol. II (1957). St. John’s University.
Carthy, Mother Mary Peter. “English Influences on Early American Catholicism.” Vol. XLIV (1959). Washington, D.C.: The Catholic University of America Press.
Land and Water Law Review. “Conscription and the Conscientious Objectors”. Joseph F. Costanzo. Vol. VI, No. 2 (1971).
American Views on Religion, Politics and Public Policy. April 2001. The Pew Forum.
The Catholic Historical Review. Vol. LXXXIX, No. 2. April 2003. The Catholic Historical Review. Vol. LXXXIX, No. 3. July 2003.
U.S. Catholic Historian. Vol. 21. No. 3. Summer 2003.

scopecontent.p: Series contains video tapes and audio cassettes covering the Focolare Movement, Marist College, and other topics in Catholicism.

did.unittitle: Knowledge Mgt. Focus Group. Marist Retirees discuss Marist teaching approaches. April 3, 2002. Senior Faculty. May 14, 2002.
Cassette Tapes. Radio Free Europe. Radio Liberty. Mar. 14, 1986. Trinity Urban Issues Forum. Oct. 11, 1995.
Bishop Fulton J. Sheen. “Life is Worth Living.” 1992. (Focolare Movement)
DeMello, Anthony S.J. Sadhana: A Way to God. Christian Exercises in Eastern Form.
Lubich, Chiara. “What We Are.” April 2002. (Focolare Movement)

scopecontent.p: Series contains assorted documents, posters, pamphlets, and newsletters dealing with education.

did.unittitle: Bulletins for institutions of Higher Learning.1944-1952.
Committee of the Catholic Commission on Intellectual and Cultural Affairs
Notes and Comment on General Education. 1950 - 1952.

scopecontent.p: Series contains various documents dealing with higher education. There are materials from the Catholic University of America as well as studies and other information on college.

did.unittitle: The Catholic University of America. The Workshop on College Organization and Administration. 1.
The Catholic University of America. The Workshop on College Organization and Administration. 2.
National Commission on Christian Higher Education

scopecontent.p: Series contains various materials having to do with sodality, including the Parish Red Book for Sodality, Instructions for Sodality Candidates, and pamphlets.
Series contains documents spanning a host of topics dealing with Catholicism and the World War years, mostly from the early – middle 1900s.

did.unittitle: Foreign Affairs Outline: Building the Peace.
2. The Catholic Church in New York

scopecontent.p: Series contains the subseries References, bibliography, Notes for Zuccarello’s Papers on the Church, Ethnic Issues, Dutchess County History, Churches/ Parishes in New York, Marist College, and Miscellaneous
Series contains references and bibliographies complied by Louis Zuccarello while doing research for his papers on Catholics in the Dutchess area.

did.unittitle: Citations from Poughkeepsie Journal and Daily Eagle
Subseries 2.2: Notes for Zuccarello’s Papers on the Church

scopecontent.p: Series contains notes taken while researching Catholicism in Dutchess County along with drafts of papers on the topic and correspondence relating to the research process.

did.unittitle: Correspondence relating to research on Catholics in the Mid-Hudson Area
Notes on Papers, Catholics in Poughkeepsie
Drafts. The Catholic Community in Poughkeepsie, 1870 - 1900: The Period of Testing
The Catholic Community in Poughkeepsie, 1870 - 1900: The Period of Testing. Editing of the Original.
Transformation of an American County. Tercentary Conference. Pluralism in the Catholic Community in 19th Century Poughkeepsie.

scopecontent.p: Series contains various documents and newspapers clippings pertaining to ethnic groups in New York and their interaction with one another.

did.unittitle: Italian American Experience in U.S. and Poughkeepsie. Materials and Clippings.
Smith, Alfred E. and Taft, Robert. Writings on, by Louis

scopecontent.p: Series contains includes a book of Louis Zuccarello’s papers on Catholicism in the Poughkeepsie area as well as Dutchess County, and Churches general history, as well as Poughkeepsie’s general history. There are also various newspaper clippings describing events in Dutchess County.

did.unittitle: The Catholic Community in the Poughkeepsie Area, Louis Zuccarello.
Dutchess Churches and Cemeteries. Photos and Clippings.
Subseries 2.5: Churches/ Parishes in New York

scopecontent.p: Series contains documents, photographs, newspaper clippings, and census data detailing the history of various parishes in New York.

did.unittitle: Stations of the Cross. Mt. Carmel.
Nativity Church, Translation of Anniversary Book
St. Peter’s Cemetery and Celtic Cross War Memorial. Photographs Enclosed. `

scopecontent.p: Series contains various documents pertaining to Marist College’s history and the Marist Brothers who began the school. Includes newspaper clippings, faculty lists, and general documents.

Series contains other documents relating to Zuccarello’s research including documents, newspaper clippings and notes on leaders in the community, clubs, and prominent religious figures. There are also church bulletins, obituaries, and other documents on Catholic issues in the area.

did.unittitle: Burtsell, McGlynn et al Accademia, North America
Clippings and Articles on Catholic Issues
